column6: Maintenance & Reliability Engineer Apply NowEmail Me Job ID SR0024054 Date posted 03/12/2019 Location:Neuchâtel, Canton of Neuchâtel An exciting and challenging opportunity has become available at Takeda Neuchâtel Plant (approx. 650 employees) within a world-class Biotech manufacturing environment for an experienced, dynamic and team-player Reliability Engineer to join our Site Engineering team. Job Summary Within the Site Engineering Department, the purpose of this role to improve the reliability of equipment & maintenance processes by applying the principles of the Takeda Reliability Engineering Program. Main Assignments Include Determine maintenance strategies & identify/implement opportunities for improvements. Apply Root Cause Analysis methodologies to improve equipment that support manufacturing operations in a dynamic, fast-paced cGMP, biotechnology environment. Measure reliability performance and demonstrate success of improvements. Lead reliability driven actions that require independent and/or collaborative judgment. Support capital projects as needed. Qualifications Proficient computer skills Understanding of Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) and Total productive Maintenance (TPM). Capacity to apply process improvement and reliability engineering principles, methodologies and tools such as Root Cause Analysis, Lean, SixSigma, DMAIC, FMEA. Capacity to operate with agility and a learning mindset so that we can accelerate breakthrough innovations. Excellent interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively and efficiently in a team-based environment. Organized and detail focused. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Fluent in French and good working knowledge in English. Education & Experience Bachelor/Master in Engineering and 3-5 years of experience in maintenance (preventive & predictive strategies) or site engineering, within a biotech/pharmaceutical manufacturing environment Knowledge of current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and quality requirements. Knowledge in one of following biotechnology equipment: Cell Culture, purification, aseptic filling, packaging, CIP, SIP, HVAC, plant and clean utilities. Knowledge of CMMS and engineering & maintenance business practices / procedures, Maximo a plus. Notice to Employment / Recruitment Agents: Employment / Recruitment agents may only submit candidates for vacancies only if they have written authorization to do so from Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda’s Talent Acquisition department. Any agency candidate submission may only be submitted to positions opened to the agency through the specific Agency Portal. Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda will only pay a fee for candidates submitted or presented where there is a fully executed contract in place between the Employment / Recruitment agents and Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda and only if the candidate is submitted via the Agency Portal. Candidates submitted or presented by Employment / Recruitment Agents without a fully executed contract or submitted through this site shall not be deemed to form part of any Engagement for which the Agency may claim remuneration.Apply NowEmail Me

Vous voulez rejoindre une équipe dynamique et acquérir une bonne expérience professionnelle dans un environnement de travail enrichissant; n'hésitez pas à postuler.Vos responsabilités     Assurer la gestion des demandes : Archivage électronique des documents (Scanning), Epp Administration (traitement des comptes employés), recherches et envoie des contrats, Curatelles, décès et traiter ces dernières en tenant compte des processus établis. Si c'est le cas, nous aimerions faire votre connaissance. Postulez en ligne (seules les candidatures en ligne seront prises en compte).CandidatureImprimer&;&;&;

column5: Spécialistes de la sécurité au travail - Génie civil et bâtiment 80-100 %
column6: Spécialistes de la sécurité au travail – Génie civil et bâtiment 80–100 % Deux postes à pourvoir au service extérieur dans le Canton de Vaud  Un emploi à la Suva est bien plus qu'un simple travail. Chez nous, vous exploitez pleinement vos potentiels et assumez des responsabilités dans un environnement de travail alliant stabilité et modernité. Vous êtes exemplaire en matière de prévention des accidents et contribuez personnellement, aux côtés de 4200 collaborateurs à la sécurité au travail et durant les loisirs. Laissez-vous surprendre et grandissez avec nous !Postuler  Ce qui vous attend   Renforcer la présence sur le terrain de nos spécialistes de sécurité  Conseiller nos clients en matière de prévention  Veiller à l’application des prescriptions légales et auditer des concepts de sécurité  Analyser des cas d’accident et convenir des mesures  Préparer et animer des conférences et des séminaires  Contribuer à l’élaboration de documents techniques et de campagnes de prévention  Convaincre des interlocuteurs variés du secteur d’activité   Ce que nous attendons de vous   Diplôme technique ou en sciences (EPF/HES)  Ingénieur de sécurité ou au minimum chargé de sécurité  Une expérience réussie dans le génie civil et bâtiment, y compris le domaine de l’amiante  Bonnes connaissances de la langue allemande  Capacité d’analyse et de prise de décision  Force de proposition mettant l’expertise à profit  Autonomie, sens de l’organisation et de la communication  Ce que nous offrons   L'occasion de réaliser vos aspirations. Personnellement, en équipe et pour l'entreprise.  Equilibre entre vie privée et vie professionnelle, esprit d'équipe et environnement de travail exceptionnel sont les ingrédients de nos conditions de travail modernes.  Chez nous, l'estime n'est pas un vain mot. Elle est perceptible quotidiennement de la part des cadres et des collaborateurs.  Une culture d'entreprise empreinte de respect, de fair-play et de transparence.  Travailler à la Suva   Envoyer par e-mail  Partager sur Facebook  Partager sur Google+  Partager sur LinkedIn  Partager sur Twitter  Partager sur XING  Partager sur WhatsApp Partager cette page Se réjouit de vous accueillir   Stéphane BettexChef du secteur génie civil et bâtiment  Tél.: +41 21 310 80 50  Enregistrer vCard  Postuler  Votre futur lieu de travail

column5: Pharma QA specialist / Swiss QP backup
column6: Job Description Summary Act as quality specialist to create and maintain Pharma quality systems (GMP and GDP compliant) for the key pharma entities regionally involved to support the business associated to pharma product included in the BD portfolio. Act as a Swiss qualified person backup and assist the Swiss qualified person in all of his/ her responsibilities.  Job Description  As Pharma QA Specialist / Swiss QP Backup reporting to our QA Manager Infection prevention, OUS , you will act as quality specialist to create and maintain Pharma quality systems (GMP and GDP compliant) for the key pharma entities regionally involved to support the business associated to pharma product included in the BD portfolio. Act as a Swiss qualified person backup and assist the Swiss qualified person in all of his/ her responsibilities. Main Responsibilities   Create and maintain Quality Systems in compliance with pharmaceutical regulations for the key entities supporting BD pharmaceutical Quality System in support of the IP platform in Europe as well as other OUS locations with a specific focus on the Regional pharmaceutical sales and distribution Quality system.  Liaise with Regulatory team to ensure maintenance of Key entities ‘license supporting the BD&; pharmaceutical Quality System  Act as Swiss acting Qualified Person according to Swissmedic’s medicinal products regulation each time required and in absence of the Swiss qualified person. Assist the Swiss QP in all the tasks and responsibilities linked to his/her role.  Liaise with the global Infection Prevention team, including local offices, marketing/sales organization or local distributors, US manufacturing and R&D, to ensure that the existing pharmaceutical Quality requirements are known and controlled.  Liaise and manage processes with EU quality team for logistics flows to ensure compliance with applicable pharmaceutical regulations. &;  Provide timely support when requested by these organizations in supporting the preparation of necessary quality documents  Proactively follow-up on Quality issues to monitor product issues in the field and ensure that they are addressed in a timely manner.  Report to the Management on the performances of the Pharmaceutical Quality Management System, including any needs for improvement.  Manage batch release for sale for the European market and GMP release for Swiss market in absence of the Swiss Qualified Person  Ensure GMP compliance of product intended for the Swiss market, including deviations and reworks when/if applicable.  When/ if applicable ensure that sub-contracted pharmaceutical distributors and key entities with GMP/ GDP activities are regularly audited and are performing in accordance with corporate requirements.  When requested by ChloraPrep manufacturing divisions, launch, document and monitor product recalls and any other remedial field actions in the affected territories and closely follow-up on the timely closure of these actions.  Pharmacist or eligible to be QP, you’ll need at least 3 years’ experience in a Quality and Regulatory Affairs position within a regulated environment and international organization. A good knowledge of GMP/GDP is mandatory and any experience in batch release, inspections and audits a plus. A conversational level of English is required as well. Proactive, with excellent verbal and written communication skills , you’ll also bring:   Strong negotiation and facilitation skills, and strong project coordination and management skills.  Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.  &;Able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions  Ability to travel 25% of time  It’s a superb, all-round QA career development role with a world leader in medical devices.&; So if this describes you and your aspirations, then please click on the APPLY button. Primary Work Location CHE Eysins - Business Park Terre-Bonne  Additional Locations  Work Shift

 pharmacist or eligible to be qp  you’ll need at least 3 years’ experience in a quality and regulatory affairs position within a regulated environment and international organization. a good knowledge of gmp gdp is mandatory and any experience in batch release  inspections and audits a plus. a conversational level of english is required as well. 
 proactive  with excellent verbal and written communication skills   you’ll also bring  
 
  strong negotiation and facilitation skills  and strong project coordination and management skills. 
  ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers  clients  customers  and the general public. 
  able to define problems  collect data  establish facts  and draw valid conclusions 
  ability to travel 25% of time 
 
  it’s a superb  all-round qa career development role with a world leader in medical devices. so i  f this describes you and your aspirations  then please click on the apply button.  
 primary work location che eysins - business park terre-bonne 
 additional locations 
 work shift

column6: La Commune de Bellevue recherche un horticulteur-trice paysagiste polyvalent-e, en contrat de durée indéterminée dès le 1er février 2019, à plein temps, attaché au Service des espaces extérieurs :&;  Formation et expérience :  - Etre âgé-e idéalement entre 30 et 45 ans ; - Etre titulaire d’un certificat fédéral de capacité (CFC) d’horticulteur – paysagiste ou formation jugée équivalente ; - Justifier d’une expérience professionnelle de plusieurs années dans le domaine ; - Posséder un permis de conduire catégorie B ; - Etre titulaire du permis de traiter dans le domaine de l’horticulture, un atout ; - Avoir l’esprit d’initiative et le sens de l’organisation ; - Avoir un esprit ouvert et le sens du contact avec la population ; - Sens de l’initiative ; - Etre en bonne santé et posséder les qualités physiques appropriées ; - Domicilié-e à Bellevue ou dans un rayon de 30 minutes au maximum.  Cette personne se verra principalement confier les activités suivantes :  • Entretien général des espaces verts, parcs, arbres, emplacements communaux et cimetière ; • Entretien général des routes et des chemins pédestres ; • Création et plantation des massifs fleuris ; • Participation aux services de piquets hivernaux ; • Toute tâche indispensable à la bonne marche du service.  Entrée en fonction : 1er février 2019.  Les personnes intéressées voudront bien soumettre leur offre, accompagnée d’un curriculum vitae, des documents usuels, ainsi que d’une photographie récente, à l’adresse : Confidentiel : Mairie de Bellevue, Route de Lausanne 329, case postale 44, 1293 Bellevue, d’ici au 30.11.2018.
column7: the commune de bellevue is looking for a versatile landscape horticulturist under contract of indefinite duration as from 1 February 2019 full-time attached to the service of the outdoor spacestraining and experience - being ideally aged between 30 and 45 - holding a federal certificate of cfc capacity d'horticulturist – landscaper or training deemed equivalent - justifying a professional experience of several years in the field - possessing a driving licence category b - holding a licence to treat in the field of horticulture an asset - having the spirit of initiative and the sense of the organization - having an open mind and a sense of contact with the population - sense of initiative - being in good health and possessing the appropriate physical qualities - domiciled in beautiful view or within a radius of 30 minutes maximum.  This person will mainly be entrusted with the following activities: • general maintenance of green areas parks trees communal pitches and cemetery • general maintenance of roads and footpaths • creation and planting of flowered massifs • participation in the services of winter pickets • any task indispensable for the proper functioning of the service.  entry into office 1 February 2019. Interested persons will be happy to submit their offer accompanied by a curriculum vitae of the usual documents as well as a recent photograph at the confidential address town hall de bellevue route de lausanne 329 postal box 44 1293 bellevue by 30.11.2018.

column6: Afin de renforcer notre équipe d'Output Management, nous recherchons au sein du siège central à Vernier/Genève un ou une Document Quality Manager à 100%.05 juin 2019 Avec près de 1.5 millions de membres, le Touring Club Suisse est le numéro un en Suisse dans les domaines de l'assistance aux véhicules et aux personnes ainsi que de la protection juridique et de la sécurité routière. Un ménage sur deux fait confiance au TCS ! Tâches principales : Dans cette fonction, votre mission principale est de participer à la production et au contrôle qualité des documents destinés à nos membres, en suivant les processus dans les délais impartis.   Définition, suivi et coordination de la planification opérationnelle de la production documentaire  Correction des erreurs et incohérences de portefeuille dans les systèmes  Contribution à l'analyse et à la documentation d'anomalies ou de demandes d'évolutions systèmes  Participation à la documentation de processus métiers et des procédures opérationnelles du service  Reporting régulier des erreurs et suivi des KPIs de génération documentaire (délai, intégrité, qualité)  Analyse et force de proposition pour l’optimisation de ses tâches  Contrôle de la qualité des documents produits en sortie (format PDF, XML …)  Votre profil :   Formation de CFC d’employé/e de commerce suivie d’une expérience similaire de 2 à 3 ans&;  Très bonnes connaissances de MS Office, notamment Excel  Vos connaissances en SQL et de Zuora seraient un atout  Bonnes connaissances du logiciel Salesforce  Personne rigoureuse, flexible, autonome et organisée  Forte orientation client et solutions  Capacité à travailler sous pression et résistance au stress  Maîtrise du français. De bonnes connaissances de l’allemand et/ou de l’anglais seraient un atout&;  Nous vous proposons : Nous vous offrons des challenges intéressants dans plus de 80 métiers différents. Nous cherchons des personnes souhaitant faire bouger les choses et intégrer des équipes pluridisciplinaires à forte culture de projet. Nos échanges se basent sur la confiance, la compréhension mutuelle et le feedback constructif. Intéressé/e par une activité variée et autonome, une atmosphère de travail agréable au sein d’une équipe qualifiée et motivée, ainsi que par les avantages sociaux d’une grande entreprise ? Alors n'hésitez pas à nous faire parvenir votre dossier on-line. Agences de placement priées de s'abstenir. Merci. Touring Club Suisse Ressources Humaines Florence Baud 1214 Vernier (GE)

In order to strengthen our team of outputs management we are looking within the head office in vernier genève for a quality management document or a 100% quality manager. 05 June 2019
 with nearly 1.5 million members the Swiss touring club is the number one in Swiss in the fields of assistance to vehicles and people as well as legal protection and road safety. One in two households trusts the ccs   
 main tasks   
 in this function your main mission is to participate in the production and quality control of documents intended for our members by following the processes within the deadlines set. 
 
  definition of monitoring and coordination of operational planning of documentary production 
  correction of errors and portfolio inconsistencies in systems 
  contribution to the analysis and documentation of anomalies or requests for system developments 
  participation in the documentation of business processes and operational procedures of the service 
  regular reporting of errors and tracking of documentary generation kpis time-limit integrity quality  
  analysis and proposal strength to optimize its tasks 
  quality control of the documents produced in output pdf format xml...  
 
 your profile   
 
  Business employee training followed by similar experience of 2 to 3 years 
  very good knowledge of ms office in particular excel 
  your knowledge of sql and zuora would be an asset 
  good knowledge of salesforce software 
  flexible, self-sustaining and organized rigorous person 
  strong customer orientation and solutions 
  ability to work under pressure and stress resistance 
  Mastery of French. good knowledge of German and/or English would be an asset 
 
 we offer you   
 We offer you interesting challenges in more than 80 different trades. We are looking for people who want to make a difference and integrate multidisciplinary teams with a strong project culture. our exchanges are based on trust mutual understanding and constructive feedback. 
 interested in a varied and self-sustaining activity a pleasant working atmosphere within a skilled and motivated team and the social benefits of a large company   
 So don't hesitate to send us your on-line file. 
  placement agencies requested to abstain. Thank you.  
  touring club swiss human resources florence baud 1214 vernier ge

column6: QA Qualification Expert - Contractor   Requisition ID:192439  Position:Full-Time Temporary  Open date:11.02.2019 08:56  Functional area:Engineering  Location:  Geneva Area, Nyon  Required degrees:Not Indicated  Relocation:Not Indicated Email a friend Your Responsibilities:  As a QA Qualification Expert within Nyon Plant you will be responsible to ensure and demonstrate that the specifications, the commissioning, the installation, the operational and performance qualification of new and modified production facilities, utilities and equipment are designed and implemented to produce a product that repeatedly and reproducibly meets critical attributes:  Further more you will be entitle to the following   - As QA representative, oversee the qualification activities (for equipment, utilities and facilities) including approval of the qualification documents (protocols and reports)  - Based on the a deep knowledge of regulatory requirements such as EU GMP, FDA and internal requirements, ensure and demonstrate that equipment, utilities and facilities are able to meet critical attributes   - Apply and develop a risk based approach as defined in ICH Q9 Guidelines, ISPE recommendations and internal requirements, focusing on the identification and assessment of risk to product quality  - Ensure that the qualifications are in compliance with regulatory requirements and expectations in consideration of the current operating environment and existing industry trends  - Ensure that acceptable ranges are defined for critical parameters  - Assist and train the System Owners for ensuring their accountability to qualify and to document the systems under their responsibility  - Perform vendor assessment in order to define their capability of fulfilling Internal Requirements and minimize risk exposure  - Ensure that Change, Deviation and CAPA’s records related to Qualification activities are in full compliance with internal requirements and regulatory guidelines.  GMP  - Respect all GMP standards  - GMP knowledge and experience to support the requirements expected by Swissmedic, European Union agencies and other regulatory bodies to assure that our products meet all cGMP requirements together with our operations and documentation system. Why You?Basic qualifications:  - Bachelor in Sciences (Engineering or Life Sciences) with proficiency in English  - Pharmaceutical industry experience is a must  - Minimum 3 years’ experience in a Pharmaceutical Quality Environment.  - Mastery in Commissioning and Qualification of Equipment and/or Facility and/or Utility  - Fluent in French and English Preferred qualifications:  To be able to assess the documentation / strategy provided by the stakeholders and to be force of proposition based on the current regulatory standards and their background  Ability to demonstrate leadership  Ability to demonstrate proficiency and thorough knowledge of system qualifications defined by applicable European & US legislations, Health authorities and/or industry groups Why GSK?:  Why GSK?   GSK is one of the world’s leading research-based pharmaceutical and healthcare companies – is committed to improving the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer.   Our offer :   At GSK we provide a supportive working environment, and a range of development challenges and opportunities. GSK is proud to promote an open culture, encouraging people to be themselves and giving their ideas a chance to flourish. GSK is an equal opportunity employee.   *LI-GSK Contact information:  You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies     GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

column6: Référence  GCA - TestQManager    Lieu de travail  Cross-Systems Genève    Type de contrat  CDI - Contrat à durée indéterminée    Rémunération  -     CROSS est une&;société de Conseil et d'Ingénierie, filiale du groupe Micropole,&;spécialisée dans les domaines de la&;Transformation Digitale, du&;Pilotage de la performance&;et de la&;Gouvernance des données. Présente en Suisse Romande depuis 1987, les 190 collaborateurs et collaboratrices qui la compose accompagnent ses clients depuis la réflexion stratégique jusqu'à la mise en œuvre de la solution et son support. Afin de renforcer nos équipes, nous recherchons à Genève un(e) : TEST / QUALITY MANAGER &; THE ENVIRONMENT As part of the Group Digital Transformation program, the Test / Quality Manager is in charge of building the Test & Quality stream and executing the global validation of business critical applications that are developed or integrated by the IT solution teams or 3rd parties. He could manage a team of internal or external people and a "Test as a Service" provider. The mission covers all functional and non-functional aspects of testing, including integration & user acceptance tests, performance, non-regression. He will report to the IT Digital Transformation Program Manager. RESPONSIBILITIES   Lead the Global Quality & Testing stream as part of the SPRING program organization  Act as the SPRING Quality manger and ensure that the deliverables meet all necessary requirements with the expected quality  Define, document and maintain a global testing strategy & governace  Select and deploy the most suitable tools for managing the test activities  Deliver clear and comprehensive KPIs reports about the quality of our deliverables  Design test plans and execute end-to-end test cases through all solutions  Manage Integration and User Acceptance Test  Oversee the testing progress s for each streams  Look for opportunities of improvement and develop new efficient procedures  &; &; &; SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE   Proven at least 10 years experience as test or quality manager in complex environments and large companies  Conscientious, autonomous, flexible and responsible  A&;keen eye for detail and a results driven approach  Outstanding communication and organizational skills  Significant experience with writing and executing functional test cases  Proven experience in team coordination and leadership  Experience with off-site test centers  Knowledge of development, testing methodologies and quality control procedures  Knowledge of data analysis/statistical methods  Certification in the domain is a strong advantage  Ready for high mobility across offices worldwide [up to 50% of the time, mostly in Geneve & France]  Fluent in English (oral and written)  French is a strong plus  Vos qualités personnelles feront la différence :&;éthique professionnelle rigoureuse, autonomie tout en ayant un esprit d’équipe, capacités d’analyse et de synthèse, écoute, créativité, sens du service, sens de la relation client, diplomatie, engagement... Chez CROSS, tout autant que votre CV et l’expérience que vous saurez mettre en avant, nous serons séduits par votre personnalité, la place que vous accordez aux relations humaines dans le travail et votre désir d’implication au sein de l’entreprise. Pour résumer, vous l’aurez compris, si vos compétences, votre désir de grandir à nos côtés et votre personnalité correspondent à notre projet d’entreprise, alors il y a de grandes chances que nous fassions route ensemble ! Donc, n’hésitez pas, venez nous rejoindre.    knowledge of data analysis statistical methods  
   certification in the domain is a strong advantage  
   ready for high mobility across offices worldwide up to 50% of the time mostly in geneve amp france   
   fluent in english oral and written   
   French is a strong plus  
 
 your personal qualities will make the differenceethical professional rigorous autonomy while having a team spirit analysis and synthesis capabilities listen creativity sense of service sense of relationship customer diplomacy engagement... 
  at cross just as much as your resume and experience as you will be able to put forward we will be seduced by your personality the place you give to human relations in the work and your desire for involvement within the company.  
 to sum up you will understand if your skills your desire to grow up with us and your personality correspond to our business project so there is a great chance that we will go together so don't hesitate to join us.

column3: Qualitätsmanagement;Teambildung und Personalentwicklung;Leidenschaft;Management;CIM;Regulatory Affairs;Teamleitung;Begeisterungsfähigkeit;Teamfähigkeit;1st and 2nd Level IT Support;Führungsqualitäten
column5: Deputy Head of Quality, Clinical & Regulatory Affairs (Geneva)
column6:
FIND is an international non-profit organization based in Geneva, Switzerland, dedicated to R&D activities to expand and accelerate access to new diagnostic technologies, and to build global capacity for diagnostic testing for poverty-related diseases in low- and middle-income countries. FIND’s vision is a world where diagnosis guides the way to health for all people. The FIND team is devoted to driving the development, clinical trialing, and early implementation of innovative diagnostic solutions that can have a high impact on patient care and disease control in low-resource settings. The Clinical Trial Unit (CTU) at FIND was established in 2018 to provide internal teams with support for their clinical development programmes. CTU services include project management, trial design, QA/compliance oversight, risk-based monitoring, data management, statistical analysis, report writing and biobanking. CTU operates in accordance with ICH GCP. You will be acting as Deputy Head of Quality, Clinical & Regulatory Affairs within CTU and support diagnostics clinical trials/studies across multiple disease programmes, including malaria/fever, hepatitis C, neglected tropical diseases, emerging threats, AMR, and tuberculosis. This role reports to the Head of Quality, Clinical & Regulatory Affairs. The specific activities will include but not be limited to:
    Providing functional expertise and strategic regulatory support to teams defining regulatory pathways for products in FIND’s portfolio Working with disease programmes in designing clinical evidence trials that meet requirements for marketing authorization and/or global policy endorsements, and demonstrating studies supporting in-country implementation or roll-out Collaborating with Trial Managers, Project Managers and Clinical Officers to ensure that clinical trial activities meet the acceptable quality standards for diagnostic tests, as defined by customer requirements and in accordance with applicable regulations, international standards and guidelines Assessing potential safety/medical device incident issues and determining reporting requirements to manufacturing partners. Maintaining and improving the CTU quality management system so as to ensure that projects which involve human subject research are conducted in conformance to ICH GCP E6 R2 guidelines, with a focus on the rights, well-being and safety of study/trial participants and data integrity Tracking issues against risks to determine effectiveness of the risk management system Tracking and reporting CTU key performance indicators to senior management Tracking lessons learnt at trial closure and performing trend analysis Assisting teams with trial site feasibility, assessment and selection as well as vendor/CRO selection. Providing support for trial start-up activities, including review of contracts, development of trial governance processes, Gantt charts, protocols, informed consent forms, case report forms and the eTMF. Developing risk-based monitoring plans and performing competency assessments of monitors in the field Hosting external audits of manufacturing partners and working with the teams to ensure any findings are addressed in a timely manner Managing complaints handling, non-conformance, review Corrective and Preventive Action plans Training staff in the management and conduct of clinical trials, as well as relevant GxP topics, CTU policies and procedures Assisting with grant applications and M&E reporting Engaging with a diverse array of stakeholders from private industry, consultants, WHO and health authorities. Managing a small, motivated team
Passion for the need and importance of new diagnostics for poverty-related diseases Advanced degree in Health or Life Sciences, or equivalent At least 8+ years of experience in a similar role in or supporting the in-vitro diagnostics (IVD) industry Ability to lead regulatory assessments of marketing claims drawing from IVD Regulatory Affairs experience In-depth knowledge of FDA and IVDR regulatory pathways, knowledge of regional or country-level regulatory and policy guidelines, ISO 13485 as well as sound understanding of product development including clinical trials/GCP and how they affect the regulatory approval timeline in different territories Experience overseeing and conducting clinical trials to include protocol design/development, site feasibility assessments, CRF design, project management, reference testing, monitoring and report writing. Experience in Quality Management, to include QA/QC, KPIs, competency assessments, SOP writing, GCP auditing, hosting external audits and regulatory inspections Experience working with CTMS/eTMF/eQMS systems and electronic data capture. Experience working in low- and middle-income countries. Strong knowledge of ISO 13485:2016, GXP, FDA and EU regulations including the IVDR. Strong analytical skills to drive complex regulatory decisions in an area with a lot of regulatory uncertainties Excellent interpersonal skills to interface with health authorities, manufacturers, suppliers, auditors and inspectors Effective communication, people and project management skills, including the ability to write well Fluent in spoken and written English; French, Spanish are a plus Ability to work in a dynamic, matrix environment with constantly changing priorities and little/no oversight Comfortable dealing with high pressure; pragmatic approach to problem solving with a high level of risk tolerance Please send a motivation letter, a CV (maximum 2 pages) and three references to hr@finddx.org by 17 March 2019 (But don’t wait until the deadline! We will start screening right away and if we find the right person, we will stop searching.) Please note that only applicants meeting the profile requirements will be personally contacted. Applications sent by recruitment agencies will not be considered

column6: GF Machining Solutions ist die weltweit führende Anbieterin von Maschinen, Automationslösungen und Serviceleistungen für den Formen- und Werkzeugbau sowie für die Fertigung von Präzisionsteilen. Als global tätiges Unternehmen ist GF Machining Solutions, eine Unternehmensgruppe des Georg Fischer Konzerns (Schweiz), mit eigener Organisation weltweit an 50 Standorten präsent. Mit unserem neuen Hauptsitz an der Roger Federer Allee in Biel bekennen wir uns aktiv zum Wirtschaftsstandort Schweiz. Im hochmodernen Werk entwickeln und produzieren wir Werkzeugmaschinen und Spindeln, die wir im Anwendungszentrum unserer anspruchsvollen Kundschaft live präsentieren. Sind Sie interessiert, in einer modernen und innovativen Arbeitsumgebung aktiv an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte mitzuwirken? &;  Ihre Aufgaben:   Verantwortlich für die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung des lokalen Managementsystems unter Berücksichtigung des Managementsystems der Division GF Machining Solutions.  Verantwortlich für die Planung und Durchführung interner Audits in Absprache mit der Division.  Sicherstellung der Konformität ISO 9001, ISO 14001 und OHSAS 18001. (In Zukunft ISO 45001)  Erarbeitung, Organisation und Durchführung von Schulungsmassnahmen für das Managementsystem, Arbeitssicherheit etc.  Koordination der laufenden Erhebung und Auswertung der Nachhaltigkeits-Daten inkl.&; Definition von Massnahmen zur Verbesserung.  Koordiniert und überwacht die Einhaltung der gesetzlichen und normativen Vorgaben.  Sicherheitsbeauftragter am Standort und unterstützt die Geschäftsleitung beim Weiterentwickeln der Sicherheitskultur und den damit verbundenen Prozessen.  Leiten der Interventions- / Sanitätsgruppe inkl. Beschaffung von Materialien, Planungen von Schulungen und erarbeiten des Budgets.   Ihr Profil:   Höhere technische Ausbildung (Ingenieur FH oder Techniker HF)  Erfahrung in der Führung und Weiterentwicklung von integrierten Managementsystemen (QEHS)  Ausbildung zum Sicherheitsbeauftragten (Sicherheitsfachmann wünschenswert)  Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office  Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und Englischkenntnisse  Hohe analytische Fähigkeiten, systematisch, eigeninitiativ, zuverlässig und verantwortungsbewusst  Bewerben

RESPONSABLE QUALITE & PHARMACOVIGILANCE H/FLe 7 mai 2019Nature du contrat: CDI Pays: Luxembourg (Luxembourg) Email de contact: bailleul-215109@cvmail.com Fondés en 1949, les laboratoires Bailleul groupe pharmaceutique indépendant, connaissent aujourd’hui, un fort développement international avec une présence dans près de 80 pays. &; Depuis près de 70 ans, nous avons toujours placé l’amélioration de la qualité de vie du patient au cœur de nos préoccupations, cherchant toujours à innover pour apporter à travers des produits de qualité, des solutions adaptées aux besoins des patients. &; Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recrutons au sein de notre Siège Européen (basé au Luxembourg), notre Responsable Qualité et Pharmacovigilance (h/f). &; Pour plus d’information&;: http://www.bailleul.com &; &; Au sein des Laboratoires Bailleul Luxembourg et directement sous la responsabilité du Directeur Affaires Réglementaires & Qualité Groupe basé à Genève, vous serez de la gestion des activités liées au système de Management de la Qualité des Laboratoires Bailleul S.A ainsi que des activités de vigilance et d’information médicale (médicaments, compléments alimentaires, cosmétiques, dispositifs médicaux) du groupe Bailleul. &; Vous serez également le Deputy Qualified Person pour les Laboratoires Bailleul Luxembourg. &; Vous serez en charge de&;:
    Qualité&;: Assurer la mise en place et l’évolution du Système de Management de la Qualité des Laboratoires Bailleul, Rédiger les procédures qualité et contrôler leur application au sein des laboratoires Bailleul. Manager les Change Control. Participer aux audits externes si nécessaire. Participer aux inspections des autorités et d’organes de certification. Assurer le suivi des CAPA plans.
&;
    Pharmacovigilance et information médicale&;:
Faire l’interface entre les responsables locaux de Pharmacovigilance et Bailleul Participer et superviser la collecte des cas de pharmacovigilance et d’information médicale Valider les réconciliations des cas de PV et d’information médicale par pays en interface avec le prestataire PV Suivre la réalisation de la veille littéraire dans chaque pays Mettre en place les SDEA avec nos partenaires locaux et les maintenir à jour Mettre en place et suivre les KPIs Préparer et maintenir à jour le PSMF Rédiger et maintenir les procédures relatives à la PV Coordonner la préparation, élaborer et soumettre les documents spécifiques PV selon les exigences européennes, ex&;: PSURs, PGR Suivre les Referral, compiler et soumettre les informations ou questions aux réponses demandées Suivre les safety meeting avec le prestataire PV Créer et maintenir les CCSI et coordonner la mise à jour des informations safety, suivre les soumissions et implémentation Communiquer les derniers SPC/PIL approuvés aux contacts locaux et au prestataire PV &; &; Titulaire d’un diplôme de pharmacien, vous avez une solide expérience dans la Qualité. Vous avez une excellente connaissance de la réglementation pharmaceutique/ compléments alimentaires/ cosmétiques ainsi que de la Pharmacovigilance et des autres vigilances. Rigoureux et autonome, vous avez une bonne capacité d’analyse et d’écoute et vous disposez d’une excellente qualité rédactionnelle. L’excellente maitrise du français et de l’anglais sont obligatoires. Une troisième langue serait un plus. &; Si vous souhaitez postuler, merci d’envoyer votre cv et votre lettre de motivation, uniquement à l’adresse suivante&;: bailleul-215109@cvmail.com

 Having a pharmacist degree you have a solid experience in quality. 
 you have an excellent knowledge of the pharmaceutical regulations cosmetic food supplements as well as pharmacovigilance and other vigilances. 
 rigorous and autonomous you have a good ability to analyze and listen and you have excellent editorial quality. 
 The excellent mastery of French and English is mandatory. A third language would be a plus.

column6: IUB Engineering SA est une société d’ingénieurs conseils ayant son siège à Berne et disposant de plusieurs succursales en Suisse. Elle appartient, tout comme sa société sœur IM Maggia Engineering SA, à la holding Engineering Société de participations SA à Locarno qui emploie plus de 270 collaborateurs. En raison de l’accroissement de notre volume de travail, nous recherchons pour le développe- ment de nos projets d'infrastructures un(e) Ingénieur(e) en génie civil Responsabilités: Dans cette fonction vous participerez à l'élaboration de projets d'envergure, de leur conception à leur réalisation. Dans un premier temps vous serez chargé(e) de la con- ception et du dimensionnement de structures. Par la suite, vous aurez également la possibilité d’assumer le rôle de chef de projet. Vous serez intégré/e dans une équipe jeune et dynamique et disposerez de l'appui de notre réseau interne de spécialistes. Votre profil: Jeune ingénieur(e) civil(e) diplômé(e) EPF/HES ou professionnel expérimenté, vous avez un intérêt marqué pour la technique. Idéalement vous avez de l'expérience dans les domaines des structures, des travaux souterrains ou de la géotechnique. Vous avez de bonnes capacités rédactionnelles et un grand sens des responsabilités. Des connaissances dans l'établissement d'offres de prestations d'ingénieur ou de la langue allemande sont des atouts. Notre offre: Nous vous offrons un poste intéressant avec un encadrement de qualité, des perspectives d’avenir et des tâches à responsabilités. Une équipe jeune et dynamique vous at- tend dans un environnement de travail calme et convivial non loin de Fribourg. Avons-nous suscité votre intérêt? Votre dossier complet est à envoyer à l'adresse ci-dessous à l'at- tention du service du personnel ou par courriel à personal@iub-ag.ch. column6: Kaizen Experte / Qualitätsmanager (m/w)  Arbeitsort: Bern | Pensum: VollzeitUnterstützen Sie uns bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Prozesskultur und leisten Sie damit einen Beitrag zum Erfolg des Geschäftsbereichs Netze. Ihre Verantwortung   Sie sind verantwortlich für die Weiterentwicklung des Kaizen Standards (Philosophie, Methoden, Prozesse)  Sie beraten die Verantwortlichen beim kontinuierlichen Veränderungs- und Verbesserungsprozess und erzielen dadurch eine positive Wirkung  Sie unterstützen die Führungskräfte und Mitarbeitenden bei der systematischen Optimierung ihrer unternehmerischen Aktivitäten, indem Sie das Kaizen-Agenten-Netzwerk professionell führen  Sie entwickeln mit Ihrem Einsatz die Kultur der Geschäftsprozesse weiter und bauen diese aus  Sie führen Schulungen durch und setzen geeignete Methoden sowie Instrumente zielgerichtet ein  Ihr Hintergrund   Kaufmännische oder technische Grundausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung im Bereich Kaizen, Lean, Qualitäts- oder Prozessmanagement (Weiterbildung mit betriebswirtschaftlichem Hintergrund notwendig; min. Stufe HF)  Ausgewiesene Praxis- und Umsetzungserfahrung im Kaizen- und/oder Qualitätsumfeld  Schnelle Auffassungsgabe von komplexen Zusammenhängen und lösungsorientierte Denkweise sowie selbstständige, zuverlässige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise  Stilsicheres Deutsch in Wort und Schrift sowie sehr gute Französischkenntnisse

column5: Total Quality Leader- Cell & Gene Therapy (m/f)
column6: Apply Now &;&;&; Total Quality Leader- Cell & Gene Therapy (m/f)    GE Healthcare  Experienced  Posted 2/12/2019 5:54:34 AM  3238105    Job Function:Quality  Business Segment: Healthcare Quality  Location(s): Switzerland; Eysins     Role Summary:  This position will lead the development and execution of the total quality strategy for the C&GT manufacturing sites (Eysins & Cambridge) focusing on both compliance and product quality. It is responsible for driving total quality metrics for the business, including the Balanced Scorecard, QMS compliance and leading the total quality business reviews with Site and Senior Leadership.     Essential Responsibilities:  -Shape the GE Healthcare total operational quality vision which translates into clear strategies and priorities for the Cell & Gene Therapy manufacturing sites.  -Responsible for site and business achievement of outcomes defined and measured by the designated quality metrics and reported on the standard site quality scorecard. Drive all site-level quality operating mechanisms and represent site along with site executive in global operating mechanisms.  -Ensure product quality is visible and actionable. Responsible for the planning, developing, directing and implementation of techniques to ensure the maintenance of quality levels in company’s products and production processes. Escalate issues, risks and deficiencies through quality, functional and operating teams where required to achieve adequate focus and attention.  -Prioritize Quality actions and uses a risk-based approach – Partners with Engineering, Manufacturing, Supplier Management and Service to determine ownership, priority, and resolution.  -Integrate closely with operations and engineering teams and staff as extended staff member and co-own Quality assurance and product quality with operating leadership. Coordinates with other sites in the same modality to ensure product issues and priorities, quality metrics are aligned, well-understood and addressed.  -Site’s point of contact to regulators. Ensure audit readiness is maintained and audit support is superbly executed. Serves as site’s management representative.  -Implement and adhere to the all applicable regulations at the site and ensure others do the same through education and training.  -Ensure day to day compliance – QMS, policy, regulatory. Stay abreast of industry Quality and Regulatory trends and developments.  -Create the total quality strategy for New Product Introductions (NPI) reviews; participate in NPI and Phase Review Discipline (PRD) reviews.  -Ensure conformance of devices is properly checked prior to final release, technical documentation for EU declaration of conformity are complete and maintained, post-market requirements are met, and reporting is completed as required. When applicable, ensures that investigational devices are handled as per required regulations.  -Support and aid in modality adoption of operational excellence improvements  -Oversee a team of Quality professionals who drive Quality throughout the various products designed and/or manufactured at the site.  -Provide visible people leadership for the organization including hiring and/or developing Quality Assurance and Product Quality personnel.     Qualifications/Requirements:  Bachelor's Degree in medicine, pharmacy, engineering or other relevant scientific discipline and a minimum of 7 years professional experience in regulatory affairs or quality management systems relating to medical devices, fluent English and fluent French language skills     Desired Characteristics:  Strong people leader – instill empowerment and trust within the organization  Change agent – drive & accelerate a Total Quality product culture  Influential leader – ability to work cross-functionally and drive wins for the business; collaborator  Strategic thinker – ability to stay out of the weeds and focus on the future state  Constructive conflict – not afraid to lean into tough conversations to get to the best outcome for the business  Demonstrated knowledge of the Quality Management System (9001/13485)  Able to react with appropriate urgency and professionalism ; make decisions under pressure  Strong business acumen – uses financial analysis to make important business decisions understands key financial metrics, can articulate the company’s business vision key business objectives, understands business trends and cycles.  Ability to handle competing priorities effectively  Master’s degree in Business or other related area  Black Belt or Master Black Belt     About Us:  GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com     Locations: Switzerland; Eysins

column5: Technical Studentships - General or Civil Engineering
column6: Company Description At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world&apos;s largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern. Diversity has been an integral part of CERN&apos;s mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Job Description One of CERN’s key missions is education.&;Our professionals very much enjoy sharing their knowledge and expertise with students who are committed and passionate about their chosen field. Imagine getting involved in work that is changing the world and imagine doing it before you’ve left university. Imagine working in an international environment and having a great quality of life. Put all these ingredients together to make this imagination a reality. There’s no better way to learn than on-the-job. When that job happens to be in a world-famous organisation and centre of scientific excellence, even better. Take part in CERN’s Technical Student Programme!&; If your university or institute requires or encourages you to acquire work experience through an internship, imagine doing this at CERN in Geneva.&;It’s more than work experience. In fact, it’s a student programme like nowhere else on Earth and an impressive addition to your CV! If you are a student looking to complete practical training in domains related to general or civil engineering, surveying or safety, you will have the opportunity to work at the cutting edge of technology, contribute and broaden your knowledge in areas as varied as industrial and tertiary building structures, design and drafting, underground structures, roads, drainage, geotechnical engineering, safety risk management to name but a few. Please note that students specialising in theoretical or experimental particle physics are not eligible to apply for this programme. The panel meets twice a year (December and May) and on each occasion, typically 120 students are selected to join the programme. Qualifications In order to qualify for a place on the programme you will need to meet the following requirements:   You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State (home.cern/about/member-states).  You have completed at least 18 months of your undergraduate studies (Bachelor or Master’s) at the time of the next student selection taking place in December 2018.&;PhD students are not eligible for this programme.  You can stay for at least 4 and at most 12 months remaining registered as a full-time student.       We advise you to opt for the longest period possible to make the most of it and increase your chances of being selected!     You have a good knowledge of English OR French.  Additional Information CERN would very much like to benefit from your expertise, commitment and passion.&; In return, CERN will provide you with:   A contract of association from 4 to 12 months.  An allowance of 3283 Swiss Francs per month (net of tax).  A travel allowance.  Depending on your personal circumstances, a supplement if you are married and/or have children.  Coverage by CERN’s comprehensive Health Insurance scheme (the contribution will be automatically deducted from your allowance).  2,5 days of paid leave per month.   This is how you can apply: You will need the following documents to complete your application (please make sure to name the documents accordingly e.g. CV, motivation letter, academic transcript...):   A CV.  A copy&;of your&;most recent academic transcript giving an overview of your marks (if you download it from your university portal please make sure there is no protection so that we can open it).  A reference letter from your University Professor (Mandatory. Should you have a letter of reference from a previous internship you may add this as a second reference).       You can upload this letter&;at the time of application if you have them to hand. You will also be provided with a link as soon as you have submitted your application to forward to your referees to upload their letters confidentially. This must be done before the closing date.     You can upload these letters at the time of application if you have them to hand. You will also be provided with a link as soon as you have submitted your application to forward to your referees to upload their letters confidentially. This must be done before the closing date. Please note that applications may be shared with a panel of national experts for evaluation purposes. Please make sure you have all the documents needed to hand as you start your application, as once it is submitted, you will not be able to upload any documents or edit your application further. Your application along with all supporting documents should reach us no later than 22.10.2018.&;It will be reviewed by a panel of CERN experts who will meet in December 2018. Please note that all the documents you upload will remain attached to your Smartrecruiters profile. You do not need to upload them again for other applications you might submit.I'm interestedPrivacy Policy

column6: Quality Assurance Specialist LocationCH-FR-Cressier   <dl>    <dt>     Requisition ID    </dt>    <dd>     2018-8143    </dd>   </dl>   <dl>    <dt>     # of Openings    </dt>    <dd>     1    </dd>   </dl>   <dl>    <dt>     Category    </dt>    <dd>     RAQA    </dd>   </dl>  Overview Bio-Rad is an innovative company and thanks to its laboratory diagnostic systems world leader in the field of blood group serology. &; Our company is involved in the supply of high-quality products and services intended for diagnostic laboratories. Independence, innovation and commitment are the fundamental values that permeate our company culture, as well as a strong orientation towards our customers and a multicultural environment. &; Bio-Rad in Cressier/Switzerland is looking for a&;Quality Assurance Specialist&;100%. Responsibilities   Acting as a QA Specialist, you will be responsaible for the processes of Change management, Management Review and Risk management. Furthermore, you will guarantee the development and the uupdate of teh company's Quality Manual.  You will guarantee the compliance of these processes to the standards and their appropriate deployment, and will provide support to users. You will monitor their performance through key indicators and be responsible for their continuous improvement.  You will evaluate and approve change requests, perform investigations and ensure the follow up of deviations and CAPAs.  You will generate training materials and ensure training sessions related to our quality management system.  You will perform internal and external audits, participate in the inspection organisation and ensure the monitoring of action plans.  You will manage projects as Project Leader and support others as Quality partner.  Qualifications   You have a Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree or qualification from a University of Applied Sciences in biology, biotechnology, life sciences or in a closely related field.  You have strong knowledge of the standards ISO 9001, 13485 and 14971, as well as of 98/79/EC and FDA requirements and of MS Office (Excel, Visio, MS Project, etc.)  You are capable of analysing complex situations, finding pragmatic solutions and communicating them in a comprehensible manner.  Fluent in French and English (spoken and written), German an asset.  Do you see your next professional challenge in this position? We look forward to receiving your application. If you click on "Apply", you have the option of submitting your complete cover letter, resume and credentials in a coherent PDF or Word document.&; To all recruitment agencies: Bio-Rad does not accept agency resumes, unless the agency has been authorized by a Bio-Rad Staffing Representative. Please do not submit resumes unless authorized to do so. Bio-Rad will not pay for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. column6: Entreprise de renommée internationale en pleine croissance, nous développons, fabriquons et commercialisons des instruments de microchirurgie de haute technologie. Depuis de nombreuses années, inventivité, innovation, qualité de nos produits et services nous ont permis d'occuper une place enviable sur le marché international. Pour soutenir ce développement et notre croissance, nous recherchons pour notre site au Noirmont, un-e INGÉNIEUR-E QUALITÉ  Vos activités :   Assurer le suivi et le traitement des non conformités internes et externes  Être garant de la bonne gestion et de l’amélioration continue du processus relatif au traitement des non-conformités  Mettre en place des indicateurs permettant l’évaluation du processus  Participer aux audits internes et externes  Analyser les réclamations clients  Participer à l’amélioration continue du Système de Management de la Qualité, en collaboration directe avec la Responsable Qualité  Participer aux validations de process  Votre profil :   Formation d’ingénieur ou de technicien, complétée par une formation dans le domaine de la Qualité  Expérience confirmée dans un poste similaire dans l’industrie, idéalement dans le domaine du dispositif médical ou pharmaceutique  Connaissance de la norme ISO 13485  Niveau d’anglais opérationnel à l’oral comme à l’écrit  Motivé par la qualité dans un environnement de développement et de production, vous faites preuve d’esprit d’initiative, d’ouverture d’esprit, de diplomatie et de pragmatisme  Bon communiquant, vous être force de propositions et savez prendre des décisions  Nous offrons l’opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise à la réputation mondiale, avec des conditions et des prestations de travail attractives. Votre dossier complet est à envoyer par e-mail à sp@bienair.com Bien-Air Surgery SA, Service du Personnel, Rue de l’Ouest 2b, 2340 Le Noirmont sp@bienair.com, www.bienairsurgery.com

column6: Responsable Assurance Qualité Montres  RefBULG02419 LocationSwitzerland LocationNEUCHATEL Responsabilités Dans le cadre de cette fonction, vous êtes responsable de la gestion de la documentation de la qualité. En étroite collaboration avec les Responsables Qualité de nos manufactures (boîtes, cadrans, mouvements et haute horlogerie), vous définissez les critères qualité de nos produits et standardisez les procédures. Vous mettez en place et communiquez les stratégies de contrôle nécessaires sur l’ensemble des aspects qualitatifs pour garantir la conformité et la fiabilité de nos composants tout au long de leur cycle de vie. Vous adaptez et faites progresser nos moyens de mesure en collaboration avec nos équipes Qualité et les formez sur les nouveaux outils. &; Vous assurez le respect de la politique qualité et la conformité réglementaire (REACH, NIHS) avec la réalisation d’audits. Vous animez les démarches préventives d’analyse des processus de production en phase projet (ADMEC, analyse fonctionnelle). &; En parallèle, vous êtes également responsable du suivi des homologations produits internes et externes. Vous pilotez les non-conformités et les demandes de modifications techniques dans la résolution de problème en lien avec notre service après-vente. &; Finalement, vous garantissez la mise en place et le suivi des indicateurs de performance qualité de notre division montres. &; Qualifications Ingénieur de formation, vous bénéficiez d’au moins 5 années d’expérience dans l’assurance qualité, idéalement dans l’horlogerie. Vous maîtrisez la Suite Microsoft Office et disposez de connaissances approfondies des systèmes de qualité (ISO 9001). De langue maternelle française, vous maîtrisez l'anglais technique, l’italien étant un avantage. &; Structuré et organisé, pragmatique et rigoureux, vous avez une bonne vision d’ensemble des problématiques rencontrées qui vous permet d’identifier les priorités et actions à mettre en place pour faire progresser l’organisation. Sensible aux besoins et contraintes des départements, vous impliquez les équipes et les aidez à évoluer en proposant des solutions d’amélioration et en apportant de la cohérence dans les procédures. Excellent communiquant, vous aimez partager votre savoir et vos compétences relationnelles vous permettent de créer des synergies afin de faciliter les échanges. ReturnApply

responsible quality assurance watches

 rental switzerland

 Responsibilities 
 As part of this function you are responsible for the management of quality documentation. in close collaboration with the quality managers of our watchmaking and movement dial boxes you define the quality criteria of our products and standardize the procedures. 
 you put in place and communicate the necessary control strategies on all qualitative aspects to ensure the conformity and reliability of our components throughout their life cycle. 
 You adapt and advance our measurement capabilities in collaboration with our quality teams and train them on the new tools. 
  
 ensure compliance with quality policy and regulatory compliance with audits. you lead the preventive steps of analysis of the production processes in phase project admec functional analysis. 
  
 In parallel you are also responsible for monitoring internal and external product approvals. 
 you pilot non-compliances and requests for technical changes in problem resolution related to our after-sales service. 
  
 finally you guarantee the implementation and monitoring of the quality performance indicators of our watch division. 
  
 qualifications 
 training engineer you benefit from at least 5 years of experience in quality assurance ideally in watchmaking. 
 you master the microsoft office suite and have in-depth knowledge of iso 9001 quality systems. French mother tongue you master technical English Italian being an advantage. 
    
 structured and organized pragmatic and rigorous you have a good overview of the problems encountered which allows you to identify the priorities and actions to be put in place to advance the organisation. sensitive to the needs and constraints of the departments you involve the teams and help them evolve by proposing improvement solutions and bringing consistency in the procedures. 
 excellent communication you like to share your knowledge and relational skills allow you to create synergies to facilitate exchanges.

column6: Wir sind ein führendes Unternehmen in der Herstellung von Präzisionsteilen aus Aluminium. Wir verfügen über ein anerkanntes Know-How in den Bereichen Kokillen- und Druckguss, Gussbearbeitung und Werkzeugbau. Unser Betrieb beschäftigt über 150 Mitarbeiter/innen. Der Standort ist bei der Autobahnausfahrt Düdingen zwischen Freiburg und Bern (A12). Für die Stärkung unseres Teams suchen wir einen Mitarbeiter Qualitätskontrolle Diese verantwortungsvolle Stelle umfasst folgende Aufgaben:   Kontrolle und Freigabe des Wareneingang/Warenausgang  Verwendung verschiedener Messmittel (Zugproben, Oberflächenmessungen, Röntgen)  Laufprüfungen in den Giessereien und mechanischer Bearbeitung  Referenzmuster verwalten  Für diese Stelle sollten Sie folgende Fähigkeiten mitbringen:   Mechanische Grundausbildung  Nach Möglichkeit Berufserfahrung in der Qualitätskontrolle  PC-Kenntnisse  Selbstständiges Arbeiten  Zuverlässigkeit  Teamfähigkeit  Von uns können Sie folgendes erwarten:   einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsplatz  eine umfassende Einarbeitung  ein motiviertes Team  Zeitgemässe Anstellungs- und Arbeitszeitbedingungen  eine der Aufgabe entsprechende Entlöhnung  Sind Sie interessiert? Wir benötigen Ihre Unterstützung in der Abteilung Überwachung. Die Abteilung Überwachung verantwortet im Rückbau die radiologische und chemische Überwachung der Anlage sowie alle Abläufe hinsichtlich Strahlenschutz und radioaktiver Abgaben. Sie ist zudem zuständig für die Lagerung und Entsorgung von radioaktiven Stoffen und die Inaktivfreigabe. Ihre Verantwortung   Ihr Team verantwortet den operationellen Strahlenschutz in der kontrollierten Zone  Sie überwachen Arbeitsplätze, betreuen Arbeiten aus strahlenschutztechnischer Sicht und leiten Strahlenschutz-Fremdpersonal an  Sie veranlassen Strahlenschutzmassnahmen, führen Strahlenschutzmessungen durch und wirken bei der Freimessung mit  Ihr Hintergrund   abgeschlossenen Berufsausbildung in einem technischen Fachbereich  Kenntnisse und Erfahrung mit Arbeiten in der kontrollierten Zone  hohe Flexibilität und Belastbarkeit sowie hohe Lernbereitschaft

column6: Lonza is one of the world’s leading and most-trusted suppliers to the pharmaceutical, biotech and specialty ingredients markets. We harness science and technology to create products that support safer and healthier living and that enhance the overall quality of life. Not only are we a custom manufacturer and developer, Lonza also offers services and products ranging from active pharmaceutical ingredients and stem-cell therapies to drinking water sanitizers, from the vitamin B compounds and organic personal care ingredients to agricultural products, and from industrial preservatives to microbial control solutions that combat dangerous viruses, bacteria and other pathogens. Further information can be found at www.lonza.com.

column6:
EMEA Quality Leader Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell Connected Building is recruiting for an exciting new position! The EMEA Quality Leader strategically lead, direct, and manage all quality management activity and the quality function across Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) for the SWISSCO EMEA Connected Buildings business with the objective of ensuring that products and processes across the businesses are compliant with internal and external quality standards. Principal Responsibilities Quality Strategy and vision Develop, communicate and implement the EMEA Connected Buildings`SWISSCo Quality strategy and vision, ensuring alignment to business strategy, goals and priorities, in order that the businesses are able to excel in quality performance terms. Ensure that employees across the organization fully understand the Quality vision, instilling a mindset in all employees of the importance of Quality in all disciplines of the business, in order that the businesses operate as highly quality focused operations. Quality Management Systems Develop and implement across the organization the internal quality procedures, policies and processes, and a Quality Management System, in order that quality standards are achieved and adhered to in all areas of the business. Product Quality Assurance Establish and manage in a coordinated and aligned manner product quality and quality assurance committees. Individual will be working closely with the business Technology and ISC organizations, in order that potential Quality problems are managed and mitigated as much as possible on an ongoing basis, throughout the product lifecycle. Ensure that independent product testing procedures are implemented in order that the level and volume of Quality problems that the customers experience is minimized. Best Practice Ensure the sharing of Quality best practice across the EMEA Connected Buildings organizations, in order that the business operates and performs in a highly effective manner through building on successes already existing in the organization. Principal Networks & Contact Links EMEA Business Leaders in Connected Buildings businesses Global HBT Quality organization, including Global NPI Quality teams Site Quality Leaders, ISC and site leadership teams Quality standards bodies Industry Associations Regulatory bodies Suppliers Customers Supervisory Responsibilities Direct Functional responsibility for EMEA Connected Buildings Quality managers . Geographic Scope & Travel Requirements Based in Rolle, Switzerland. Frequent travel required to EMEA Connected Buildings locations, and all other HBT locations globally. Regular additional overseas travel as required.20 Coach and develop team20 Lead improvement initiatives20 Work on cross functional teams20 Issue corrective actions20 Customer and supplier relation
EXPERIENCE AND TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
Educated to minimum of degree level in a Technical and/or Business discipline. Bachelor’s Degree preferred. Minimum 5 years Quality Assurance experience in electronics based products. Knowledge of and experience in working within an ISO9001 framework. In depth knowledge of quality and industrial standards. Knowledge of lean thinking methods and techniques. High level of technical aptitude and understanding, able to understand and work with technical processes and documentation. Proven strong project & program management skills.
BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES REQUIRED
In depth quality assurance and manufacturing experience High level of both written and verbal Communication Skills, capable of adapting style and tone according to the situation and audience. high level of influencing skills, capable of influencing in order to obtain information request at short notice. Excellent leadership silks, with demonstrated ability to lead or work with a virtual team. Excellent problem solver, able to use sound analytical and problem solving skills to achieve good results. Solid level of Business Acumen, able to demonstrate a clear understanding of business and market issues both internal and external to Honeywell. Demonstrates a high level of planning & organization skills on a daily basis. Highly Customer Focused approach, demonstrating success through a ‘Voice of the Customer’ approach on a daily basis. Highly self-aware, recognizing the impact of approach and behaviors on peers, direct reports, customers and other internal and external contacts. Demonstration of the Honeywell Behaviors. Exempt Careers at Honeywell - Engineering
INCLUDES
Some Travel Required Continued Professional Development
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Job ID: HRD43507 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: Z.A. La Pièce 16, Rolle, VD 1180 CHE Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. column6: Die KADI AG, Langenthal gehört zu den führenden Schweizer Herstellern qualitativ hochwertiger Convenience Produkte im Kühl- und Tiefkühlbereich für alle Bereiche der Gastronomie sowie den Detailhandel. In Ergänzung zu unserer Qualitätsleitung suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n Fachspezialist/in Qualitätssicherung 100 %  (befristet bis Januar 2019) Ihre Aufgaben Sie führen die Qualitätskontrolle/Überwachung von Rohstoffen, Halbfabrikaten, Fertigfabrikaten und Handelswaren durch und unterstützen das Team im Tagesgeschäft. Sie lösen die Probleme bei Abweichungen selbständig und strukturiert. Resultate und Qualitätskennzahlen werten Sie kontinuierlich aus und leiten davon Folgemassnahmen ab. Sie verwalten sämtliche Prüfmittel und bieten täglich Fachsupport. Des Weiteren übernehmen Sie Monitoring-Tätigkeiten, ausgehend vom HACCP-Konzept. Die Weiterentwicklung der Prozesse und Methoden liegen in Ihrem Aufgabengebiet. Ihr Profil Sie sind eine unternehmerisch denkende Persönlichkeit mit einem abgeschlossen Studium als Lebensmittelingenieur/in FH oder ETH. Sie verfügen über gute Kenntnisse der verschiedenen Analyse- und Auswertungsmethoden und kennen die gängigen QS-Richtlinien und Standards. Zu Ihren Stärken gehören eine analytische und vernetzte Denkweise, Durchsetzungsvermögen sowie Zuverlässigkeit. Ihre Arbeitsweise ist exakt und effektiv, auch in hektischen Zeiten behalten Sie den Überblick. Sie arbeiten gerne selbstständig, übernehmen Verantwortung in Ihrem Aufgabenbereich und die kontinuierliche Verbesserung zusammen mit Mitarbeitenden aller Stufen begeistert Sie. Wir bieten Ihnen Sie gewinnen eine vielseitige, anspruchsvolle und interessante Tätigkeit. Sie erleben bei uns Freiraum für Selbständigkeit und Eigeninitiative sowie eine offene, teamorientierte Unternehmenskultur. Haben wir Sie neugierig gemacht? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen über das Ostendis Bewerbungssystem www.ostendis.ch (Job-ID 16509) oder per E-Mail. Weitere Auskünfte erhalten Sie von Frau Rebecca Steiner, Tel. 062 916 05 30. KADI AG, Kühl- und Tiefkühlprodukte Rebecca Steiner, Personalabteilung Thunstettenstrasse 27, 4900 Langenthal www.kadi.ch, personal@kadi.ch

column6: Plan your career with usRUAG Space is part of the international RUAG group which is active in the fields of Aerospace and Defence and employs more than 9,000 employees worldwide. We are Europe's largest, independent supplier to the aerospace industry. In Switzerland, Sweden, Austria, Finland, Germany and in the USA we develop, produce and test subsystems and components for Space applications. Heritage, flexibility and outstanding reliability make RUAG Space the partner of choice for producers of satellites and the launch services industry all over the world.Apply nowRUAG Slip Rings AG in Nyon is looking for an experienced quality professional who enjoys a wide variety of topics in the Space and Non-Space area. Your responsibilities   Disciplinary and operative lead of the Product Assurance business in accordance with customer requirements in order to guarantee the compliance of the delivered product  Develop the activities linked to the audits of the key suppliers and lead the Supplier Quality Assurance business in close coordination with the Project and Procurement Teams  Lead non-conformance analysis review (internal, customer and supplier level)  Maintain the Quality Management System and ISO certification in close collaboration with RUAG Space Central quality  Your profile   University Degree in Aerospace/Mechanical/Materials or Electrical Engineering  Professional experience in Product Assurance and/or Quality Management  Material and Process knowledge with some industrial and international standards (esp. MIL and ESCC) experience would be an asset  Attracted by both on-the-field and office work;  Strong test for business and process improvement  Very good command of French and English  Pragmatic, dedicated with a resourceful and solution-oriented thinking style  High autonomy, reliable and precise way of working

column6: Die Schweizerische Arbeitsgemeinschaft für Klinische Krebsforschung (www.sakk.ch) ist das Krebsforschungsnetzwerk der Schweiz und beschäftigt über 70 Mitarbeitende am SAKK Ko- ordinationszentrum. Gemäss unserer Vision „We bring progress to cancer care“ führen wir seit 1965 als Non-Profit-Organisation klinische Studien in der Onkologie durch. Als Verstär- kung für unser Quality Assurance Team (QA) suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine motivierte und dienstleistungsorientierte Persönlichkeit als Quality Assurance Manager GxP 40 - 50% Diese Stelle ist auf ein Jahr befristet bis 31.08.2019. Die Überführung der Stelle in eine feste Position ist eine mögliche, zukünftige Option. Ihre Aufgaben:   Verantwortlich für das interne SOP Management System  Unterstützung des Head QA&RA bei der Durchführung von internen Schulungen und Nachführung der Schulungsdokumentation  Unterstützung des Head QA&RA bei der Durchführung von Audits an SAKK Prüfzen- tren und bei Lieferanten (gemäss GCP, GMP und GDP)  Selbständige Bearbeitungen von Temperaturabweichungsmeldungen von Studienme- dikamenten  Unterstützung des Head QA&RA bei der Bearbeitung von Abweichungen und Ände- rungen (change control)  Was Sie mitbringen:   Naturwissenschaftliche Grundausbildung (Master Fachschule oder universitärer Ab- schluss)  Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Qualitätssicherung im GxP Umfeld  Selbständigkeit, Zuverlässigkeit, Termintreue und Pragmatismus  Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement  Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit bereichsübergreifend zu arbeiten  Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten  Gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  Wir bieten Ihnen:   Eine spannende, verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe im Bereich der akademischen klini- schen Forschung  Sehr attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen (Jahresarbeitszeit, auf Wunsch 6 Wochen Ferien)  Gutes dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld in Bahnhofsnähe  Für Auskünfte steht Ihnen der Leiter QA, RA und Pharmacovigilance, Dr. Peter Durrer (031 508 42 05), gerne zur Verfügung. Bitte senden Sie Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen mit dem Vermerk: „QA“ elektronisch (in PDF Format) an contact@sakk.ch oder an SAKK Koordinati- onszentrum, Stéphanie Mohler, Head of Human Resources, Effingerstrasse 33, 3008 Bern.

the Swiss working group for clinical cancer research www.sakk.ch is Switzerland's cancer research network and employs more than 70 co-workers at the sakk coordination centre. according to our vision "we bring progress to cancer care" we have been conducting clinical studies in oncology since 1965 as a non-profit organization. as a reinforcement for our quality assurance team qa we are looking for a motivated and service-oriented personality as an immediate or agreement 
  quality assurance manager gxp 40 - 50%  
 this post is limited to one year until 31.08.2019. the transfer of the post into a fixed position is a possible future option.

  responsible for the internal sop management system 
  support of the head qa amp ra in the execution of internal training and follow-up of training documentation 
  support of the head qa amp ra in the execution of audits at sakk test stations and at suppliers according to gcp gmp and gdp  
  Independent processing of temperature deviation reports of study subjects 
  support of head qa ampra in the processing of deviations and changes change control  
 
  what they bring with them   
 
  basic scientific education master technical school or university degree  
  at least 3 years experience in quality assurance in gxp environment 
  independence reliability punctuality and pragmatism 
  experience in project management 
  teamwork ability and ability to work across areas 
  very good communication skills 
  good knowledge of German and English in word and writing
